awards.title: Best oral presentation at International Congress of Biophysics of Photosynthesis 2019 Roma
awards.description: Best oral presentation prize at "International Congress of Biophysics of Photosynthesis: from molecules to the field" at Academia dei Lincei in Rome

awards.title: HPC-Europa3 Transnational Access Programme Grant
awards.description: Was awarded with the HPC-Europa3 Transnational Access Programme Grant, which provided funding and time on the supercomputer cluster of Cineca in Italy to do a 3 week research project. I was hosted by prof. dr.  Leonardo Guidoni of the University of L'Aquila. We performed quantum mechanical simulations on photosynthetic systems to elucidate and understand their optical spectra.

publications.name: Harvesting Far-Red Light with Plant Antenna Complexes Incorporating Chlorophyll d

profile_positions.description: Phd student at the Biophysics of Photosynthesis group of the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. The research focuses on incorporating novel far-red absorbing chlorophylls in plants in order to increase their photosynthetic yield.
profile_positions.title: Phd

profile_positions.description:
Afstudeerstage bij La Sapienza Università di Roma bij de 'Computational Biophysics Biochemistry and Chemistry' groep onder leiding van Prof. dr. Leonardo Guidoni. Tijdens deze stage deed ik onderzoek naar het complex P700, waar in photosynthetische organismen de omzetting van zonlicht naar chemische energie begint. Met behulp van quantum mechanistische berekeningen heb ik het infrarood-, absorptie- en Raman resonantie spetrum van dit complex en zijn afzonderlijke componenten berekend om zo meer te weten te komen over zijn werking binnen photosynthese. Voornamelijk heb ik hiervoor de computerprogramma's CP2K en Orca gebruikt.

Research internship at La Sapienza Università di Roma at the 'Computational Biophysics Biochemistry and Chemistry' group of Prof. dr. Leonardo Guidoni. During this internship I did research on the complex P700, which is the starting point for the conversion of sunlight into chemical energy in photosynthetic organisms. Employing a quantum mechanical level of theory I have calculated the infrared-, absorption- and Raman resonance spectrum of this complex and its individual components in order to shed light on its working within the process of photosynthesis. The calculations were predominately conducted using the computer programs CP2K and Orca.

Laureando alla Sapienza Università di Roma al gruppo 'Computational Biophysics Biochemistry ' di Prof. dr. Leonardo Guidoni. Durante questo tironcino ho ricercato il complesso P700, che è il punto di partenza per la conversione della luce solare in energia chimica negli organismi fotosintetici. Con calcoli, a base della teoria quantum mechanica, ho calcolato lo spettro IR, d'assorbimento e Raman risonanza del P700 ed i suoi componenti individuali per delucidare  il suo funzionamento nella fotosintesi. Ho effetuato i calcoli prevalentamente con i programmi per computer CP2K ed Orca.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
Onderzoekstage bij het bedrijf ENGIE Energy Solutions (EES). Tijdens dit project heb ik de barrières die momenteel de adoptie van warmte-koudeopslag (WKO) systemen in de grote utiliteitsmarkt in Nederland in kaart gebracht en heb ik enkele maatregelen ontworpen om deze barrières te bestrijden. Daarnaast heb ik een analyse gedaan naar de manieren om een koudeoverschot bij een bepaald WKO-systeem op een duurzame en economisch gunstige manier te verhelpen.

Research internship at the Energy Solutions departement of ENGIE (EES). During this project I have mapped the barriers that are currently impeding the adoption of open Aquifer Thermal Energy Storage (ATES) systems in the large utility market in the Netherlands and designed some measures for counteracting them. Furthermore, my goal was to find a sustainable and economically viable solution for mediating the thermal unbalance, in the form of a cold-surplus, at a large ATES-system that is exploited by EES.
profile_positions.title: Research intern

profile_positions.description:
Research internship at the biophysics of photosynthesis departement of the VU under supervion of prof. dr. Croce. 

Abstract:
Carotenoids are present in large amounts in plants and algae both free in the thylakoid membrane 
and bound to the Light-Harvesting Complexes (LHCs). They play vital roles in photosynthesis participating in light-harvesting - by capturing photons in the blue-green spectral region - and in 
photoprotection -  by eventually quenching dangerous chlorophyll triplets and highly reactive oxygen species. The aim of this project was to investigate the effect of the carotenoids on the properties of model membranes via Molecular Dynamics simulations (MDs). As a first step we created topologies compatible with the GROMOS force field for the carotenoids zeaxanthin, neoxanthin, lutein and violaxanthin. Parameters were also derived for the detergent n-dodecyl-β-d-maltoside (DDM), commonly used to solubilize the photosynthetic subunits (a.e. LHCs) for in vitro studies. By studying simple systems composed of single carotenoids in a model membrane, we observe that the carotenoids have a thickening effect on the hydrophobic core of the lipids of the model membrane. Moreover, we did not observe a relation between the average angular orientation of the carotenoid, the length between hydroxyl groups within the particular carotenoid and the hydrophobic core thickness of the membrane, as was suggested in previous scientific literature. Furthermore, it’s observed that carotenoids can spontaneously undergo rotational flip-flop’s in the lipid membrane. The probability for this event increases as the temperature rises. Moreover, no ordering effect on the membrane by the carotenoids is observed. Finally, it is shown that the topology that we have derived for DDM yields MD data that are in fair agreement with experimental studies. The partial charges of this topology need further improvement.
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description: Meewerken aan het schrijven van de nieuwsberichten op thebluedeal.nl/nieuws. Daarbij inhoudelijke ondersteuning voor projecten met betrekking tot duurzame energie.

profile_positions.description: Onderzoek naar de huidige stand van zaken in de energietransitie en een overzicht van de aantrekkelijkheid van de energietechnieken naar de pijlers van maatschappelijke acceptatie. Daarnaast inhoudelijke ondersteuning bij consultancy projecten van het bedrijf op zowel technisch als bedrijfseconomisch gebied.
